law.catch_line: The Baltimore County Board consists of 12 members who shall be appointed as follows:...

text.section:
The Baltimore County Board consists of 12 members who shall be appointed as follows:
Four from the county at large;
One from each of the seven councilmanic districts in Baltimore County; and
One student member from the county at large.

section.section:
The student member shall:
Be an eleventh or twelfth grade student in the Baltimore County public school system;
Serve for 1 year; and
Advise the board on the thoughts and feelings of students.

Unless invited to attend by an affirmative vote of a majority of the county board, the student member may not attend an executive session that relates to:
Hearings on appeals of special education placements;
Hearings held under § 6-202(a) of this article; or
Collective bargaining.

On a majority vote of the nonstudent members, the board may determine, on a case-by-case basis, whether a matter under consideration is covered by the exclusionary provisions listed in paragraph (3) of this subsection.

text.section: A board member who does not maintain his residential qualification shall be replaced as a member.

If the boundary line of a councilmanic district is changed, the term of an incumbent member of the county board who no longer resides in the councilmanic district because of the change is not affected during this term.
A county employee Council member who does not maintain his employment in the county shall be replaced.

The Council shall:
Meet as needed to compile the number of spaces in the public schools of the county that are not filled and to evaluate the feasibility of the utilization of the spaces by the community and county departments; and
Report its findings and recommendations to the county board of education and the County Executive at least twice during the school year.
The County Executive may, by executive order, appoint up to two additional members to the Council from agencies of the county government.
